snippet: Chevron said Friday that it had no intention of apologizing for the environmental damage to the Amazon rain forest for which an Ecuadorean court ruled it responsible.
abstract: Chevron says that it has no intention of apologizing for the environmental damage to the Amazon rain forest for which an Ecuadorean court ruled it responsible; attorneys for both sides say that if Chevron apologizes, its legal liability of $18 billion will be cut to $9.5 billion.
lead_paragraph: Chevron said Friday that it had no intention of apologizing for the environmental damage to the Amazon rain forest for which an Ecuadorean court ruled it responsible.

headline.main: Ecuador: Chevron Will Not Apologize for Pollution, Even to Save $8.5 Billion
headline.print_headline: Ecuador: Chevron Will Not Apologize For Pollution, Even to Save $8.5 Billion
